text:
hello this is Chef John from foodwishes.com
with Salmon baked on aromatic salt

this really interesting recipes was inspired
by or acutally

I was reminded of it by chef Paul Bartolotta
at Vegas un'corked at the

interactive lunch he did whole fish
baked in salt it was fantastic
really amazing I will at some point

demo how to do a whole baked fish in salt
because that's also incredibly cool and

even more succulent so that reminded me of
a salmon baked on salt recipe that

michelle used to make a long time ago so I'm
going to show you it's really kind of cool

all right so I'm going to take a bowl and I'm going
to add two cups of course salt i'm using kosher salt
you can use coarse sea salt

you can use rock salt just don't use
fine table salt it is too fine

then we're going to add our aromatics which is
going to be listed on the blog all the amounts

I got a whole bunch of  pepper corns star anise
cinnamon clove
but you can put whatever you want
this is just a technique

pour that into a casserole dish baking dish and
then you're going to lay over your salmon fillet

but make sure you buy salmon with
skin

the skin will protect it against the
salt direct contact lay that on top cut a little

piece of parchment the same size as the fish no
need to oil don't put anything on top of the

fish seal it with foil and place
that in a 375 degree oven
for twenty minutes
then check

so these are like seven eight ounce
pieces of fish nice big fillets

so mine was just almost done now it
looks like that just because the parchment
on there

it was insulated a little bit so the top
looks undercooked but if i just leave

this on the hot salt wrapped for another
two three minutes it cooked perfectly

right don't let that little bit of pink
on the surface bother you, you feel with

your finger you can feel it's just firm
and that's going to be incredibly

succulent you see here I served mine very
simply arugula salad on top of a

crispy flat bread just a beautiful week
night dinner with fresh chives little

cayenne you know i have a cayenne fetish
cooking it on the salt just adds

something it just really makes for a
nice nice piece of fish and of course

all those spices in the salt just permeate
and give it a really subtle really

interesting flavor you're going to love this
really really fun interesting presentation

specially for a party you get some ooh's maybe
a couple of ahh's and who knows you might even
get a woohoo

of course if you want to serve it with some
fresh lemon or a little extra salt
spinkled over the top ... totally fine
probably a good idea
i didn't do it, didn't need it

and that's it salmon cooked on aromatic salt,  a
little bit unusual little bit exotic

but incredibly simple go to the site all the
ingredients are there
and as always
Enjoy!
